result.execSummary:
The defendant Stasha T Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12-17-15. Court waived DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stasha T Mitchell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12/17/15.  Court waived DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Stasha T Mitchell in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 937.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Stasha T Mitchell in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stasha T Mitchell in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant would like a trial date but Attorney Vega is retiring and new counsel needs to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stasha T Mitchell in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Joseph Wasserman, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM014301  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-17-15
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  Derrick T.    AND/OR  his residence   AND/OR  his place of employment

No dangerous weapons

Defendant Stasha T Mitchell in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-053

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 40 for a Pretrial Conference.
